alert.note: Alert for Collier; Glades; Hendry (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 5:21PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following counties, Collier, Glades and Hendry. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 518 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms.Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen form these thunderstorms over western Glades County during the last couple of hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected with these thunderstorms as they drift slowly southward into Northwest Hendry County. This additional rain will result in minor flooding as the ground are already somewhat saturated from heavy rains from last weekend. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood Warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Labelle, Immokalee, Ave Maria, Felda, Port La Belle, Ortona, Devils Garden, Muse, Keri, Bunker Hill and Lake Trafford. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
